<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Map each group of one or two GPRs to corresponding VSR for spilling.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Use local table in methods to avoid this mutable member.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">mutable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;unsigned, std::pair&lt;Register, Register&gt;</a>&gt; VSRContainingGPRs;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">  /&#42;&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; Find register&#91;s&#93; that can be used in function prologue and epilogue</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; Find register&#91;s&#93; that can be use as scratch register&#91;s&#93; in function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; prologue and epilogue to save various registers (Link Register, Base</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; Pointer, etc.). Prefer R0/R12, if available. Otherwise choose whatever</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; register&#91;s&#93; are available.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; This method will return true if it is able to find enough unique scratch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; registers (1 or 2 depending on the requirement). If it is unable to find</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; enough available registers in the block, it will return false and set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; any passed output parameter that corresponds to a required unique register</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; to PPC::NoRegister.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; \\param&#91;in&#93; MBB The machine basic block to find an available register for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; \\param&#91;in&#93; UseAtEnd Specify whether the scratch register will be used at</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                     the end of the basic block (i.e., will the scratch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                     register kill a register defined in the basic block)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; \\param&#91;in&#93; TwoUniqueRegsRequired Specify whether this basic block will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                                  require two unique scratch registers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; \\param&#91;out&#93; SR1 The scratch register to use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; \\param&#91;out&#93; SR2 The second scratch register. If this pointer is not null</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                 the function will attempt to set it to an available</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                 register regardless of whether there is a hard requirement</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                 for two unique scratch registers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; \\return true if the required number of registers was found.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;         false if the required number of scratch register weren&#39;t available.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;         If either output parameter refers to a required scratch register</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;         that isn&#39;t available, it will be set to an invalid value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
